eu.mondo.mondix.core

Interface IMondixRelation

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IChangeAwareMondixRelation
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRelation, ChangeAwareMondixRelation, DefaultMondixRelation

    public interface IMondixRelation
    Represents a base relation for which queries can be opened.
    Author:
    Bergmann Gabor

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getArity()
      Returns the number of parameters/columns of this relation.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getColumns()
      Returns an ordered list of column names.
      IMondixInstance getIndexerInstance()
      Returns the indexer instance that owns and maintains this base relation.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of this relation that uniquely identifies it within the indexer instance.
      IQueryInstance openQueryInstance()
      Returns a query instance against the entire contents of the relation.
      IQueryInstance openQueryInstance(java.util.List<java.lang.String> selectedColumnNames, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> filter)
      Returns a query instance filtered to the given values that only returns the selected columns.

    • Method Detail

      • getIndexerInstance

        IMondixInstance getIndexerInstance()
        Returns the indexer instance that owns and maintains this base relation.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of this relation that uniquely identifies it within the indexer instance.

      • getColumns

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getColumns()
        Returns an ordered list of column names.

      • getArity

        int getArity()
        Returns the number of parameters/columns of this relation.

        Equivalent to getColumns().size()

      • openQueryInstance

        IQueryInstance openQueryInstance()
        Returns a query instance against the entire contents of the relation.

        Result should be disposed if no longer used.

        Same as openQueryInstance(List, Map) parameterized by (null, null).

      • openQueryInstance

        IQueryInstance openQueryInstance(java.util.List<java.lang.String> selectedColumnNames,
                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> filter)
        Returns a query instance filtered to the given values that only returns the selected columns.

        Result should be disposed if no longer used.

        Guaranteed to return IUnaryQueryInstance or INullaryQueryInstance if 1 respectively 0 columns are selected.

        Parameters:
        selectedColumnNames - the ordered, unique list of columns that should be returned for tuples in this relation (can be empty). If null is given, all columns are selected in the original order (see getColumns()).
        filter - a map from zero or more column names to concrete values. The query will be filtered to those tuples only that take the given values at the given columns. If null is given, no filtering is done (equivalently to an empty map).
